Tools¶

A set of tools have been developed in order to easier the work with the internal representation.

Tree Tools¶

Tree manipulation tools

class Tools.Tree.InsertTool(subtree=None, position='begin', node=None)¶

Inserts the childs of a node (a subtree) on the given position.

Note

It doesn’t insert the parent node of the new subtree.

Example:
>>> InsertTool(subtree = kernel_init_subtree, position = "begin").apply(cuda_stmts, 'decls')
apply(target_node, attribute_name)¶

Apply the insertion on the attribute of the target node

Updates the parent link of the subtree

Parameters:
  • target_node – Node where insert the subtree
  • attribute_name – Attribute of the target_node where the subtree is to be inserted
Returns:

Target node after insertion
class Tools.Tree.RemoveTool(target_node)¶

Remove a subtree from the AST

apply(target_subtree, attribute_name)¶

Apply the removal

Parameters:
  • target_subtree – target_subtree where target_node resides
  • attribute_name – Name of the attribute where the target_node resides in the target_subtree
Returns:

Target subtree (container of the removed target_node)
class Tools.Tree.ReplaceTool(new_node, old_node)¶

Replace a subtree with another

>>> ReplaceTool(new_node = cuda_stmts, old_node = self._parallel.parent).apply(self._parallel.parent.parent, 'stmts')
apply(target_node, attribute_name)¶

Apply the replace, effectively changing self.old_node by self.new_node

Parameters:
  • target_node – parent node of old_node
  • attribute_name – Attribute name which contains the old_node on the parent
Returns:

Target Node after replace

Serialization Tools¶

class Tools.Dump.Dump¶

Serializer class for Internal Representation

static exists(name)¶

Check if a given tree serialization exists

Parameter:name – Name of the frozen tree
static load(name)¶

Deserialize a frozen AST

Parameter:name – Name of the frozen tree
static save(name, tree)¶

Serialize an AST

Parameter:name – Name of the frozen tree

Declarations Tools¶

Provide functionality to look for declarations on the AST

Tools.Declarations.decl_of_id(id, ast)¶

Returns the TypeDecl node of a given ID node

Because we don’t have a symbol table, we transverse the tree using the parent link attribute, in order to find the declaration of the identifier. This process is slow, a symbol table needs to be implemented.

Parameters:
  • id – ID Node
  • ast – Pointer to start reverse search
Returns:

Decl node of the identifier
Tools.Declarations.type_of_id(id, ast)¶

Returns the TypeDecl node of a given ID node

Calls decl_of_id but returns the type argument

Return type:TypeDecl node of a given ID node
Tools.Declarations.type_of_node(node, ast)¶

Returns the TypeDecl node of an expression

Rules are: double>float>int

Return type:TypeDecl node of a given expression node

Debug Tools¶

class Tools.Debug.DotDebugTool(highlight=None)¶

Display the tree with xdot, highlighting the given nodes

Parameter:highlight – Nodes to highlight, default: None

Warning

This tool requires xdot in config.WORKDIR, and uses a temporary storage for the dot file

apply(node)¶

Display the given node (or list of nodes)

Parameter:node – Node or list of nodes to begin display
debug_node(node)¶

Display the given node (or list of nodes)

Parameter:node – Node to display
